content.statement: pad-010-surgical-bypass is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Peripheral-Arterial-Disease that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding pad-010-surgical-bypass helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of pad-010-surgical-bypass include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of pad-010-surgical-bypass.

indications.clti: Chronic limb-threatening ischemia with rest pain, ulcer, or gangrene
indications.claudication: Rarely - only severe, lifestyle-limiting claudication after failed medical/exercise therapy
indications.failed_endovascular: After unsuccessful or recurrent stenosis from endovascular treatment

great_saphenous_vein.priority: First choice for all infrainguinal bypass

alternative_vein.spliced_vein: Acceptable when single adequate vein unavailable

prosthetic.use: Only above-knee femoropopliteal if no vein available
prosthetic.adjuncts: Venous cuff (Miller cuff, Taylor patch) may improve BK prosthetic patency

preoperative.vein_mapping: Duplex ultrasound to assess GSV diameter, quality, and availability
preoperative.arterial_imaging: CTA, MRA, or angiography to plan inflow and outflow

outcomes.limb_salvage: 80-90% at 5 years for GSV bypass in CLI
outcomes.surveillance: Duplex every 3-6 months to detect stenosis before graft failure

definition.@value: Surgical revascularization using autogenous vein or prosthetic conduit to bypass arterial occlusion

clinical_pearls: GSV is king - always use autogenous vein if possible
Preoperative vein mapping is ESSENTIAL - know your conduit before surgery
Avoid prosthetic for below-knee targets - 30-40% 5-year patency
Graft surveillance prevents failure - duplex every 3-6 months

medicalCode.description: Bypass graft, with vein; femoral-anterior tibial, posterior tibial, peroneal artery or other distal vessels

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
